SEARCH
Package com.example.eventlottery.fragments

Class AdminEventsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.eventlottery.fragments.AdminEventsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class AdminEventsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
AdminEventsFragment provides an interface for administrators to manage events. It allows viewing a list of all events, searching/filtering them, viewing details, and deleting events.

  • Method Details

    • onCreateView

      @Nullable public android.view.View onCreateView(@NonNull android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable android.view.ViewGroup container, @Nullable android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Initializes the fragment's UI components and sets up listeners for data loading and user interaction.
      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment.
      container - If non-null, this is the parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to.
      savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state.
      Returns:
      The View for the fragment's UI.

    • setupSearchListener

      private void setupSearchListener()
      Sets up a TextWatcher on the search bar to filter the event list as the user types.

    • loadEventsFromFirestore

      private void loadEventsFromFirestore()
      Connects to Firestore to listen for real-time updates to the "events" collection. When data changes, it updates the local list and refreshes the display.

    • filterEvents

      private void filterEvents(String query)
      Filters the list of events based on the search query. Matches against event name or organizer name.
      Parameters:
      query - The search string entered by the user.

    • displayEvents

      private void displayEvents()
      Clears the current list view and repopulates it with cards for the filtered events.

    • addEventCard

      private void addEventCard(AdminEventsFragment.EventData event)
      Inflates a new event card view, populates it with data, and adds it to the list layout. Sets up click listeners for the "View Details" and "Delete" buttons.
      Parameters:
      event - The EventData object containing details to display.

    • viewEventDetails

      private void viewEventDetails(String eventId, String eventName)
      Navigates to the EventDetailActivity to show more information about the selected event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to view.
      eventName - The name of the event (passed for context).

    • deleteEvent

      private void deleteEvent(String eventId, String eventName)
      Shows a confirmation dialog to delete an event. If confirmed, deletes the event from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to delete.
      eventName - The name of the event (used in the confirmation message).

    • showLoading

      private void showLoading(boolean show)
      Toggles the visibility of the loading spinner and the event list.
      Parameters:
      show - True to show the loading spinner, false to show the list.

    • showEmptyMessage

      private void showEmptyMessage()
      Displays a message indicating that no events match the current search or exist in the database.

    • showError

      private void showError(String message)
      Displays a toast message with an error description.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to display.

    • onDestroyView

      public void onDestroyView()
      Cleans up resources when the fragment view is destroyed, specifically removing the Firestore listener.
      Overrides:
      onDestroyView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
